author: KaiDaigoji
comment: I know this wont be the most popular opinion here but here goesThe Bible isnt fictionI dont say that because Im some sort of fundamentalist Im an atheist or because I believe its true  I dont  I say it because literature is my thing and weve gotten sloppy with our termsNonfiction doesnt mean true and fiction doesnt mean false  Both of these are genres that entail a lot of assumptions of how the author intends for the audience to approach the piece of literature  For example in fiction the author knows that the audience will approach it as a narrative story designed for entertainment  This is completely different from a piece that is untrue but nonfictionFor example the ancient aliens stuff on history channel isnt presented as fiction  You could do basically the same show but mockumentary style and put it on Sci Fi network no I dont mean SyFy I mean go back in time to when that network was good and it would be fiction  But the presentation of the show now is nonfictional  At our most charitable we could say that its people discussing a certain interpretation of history  the show intends for people to take it seriously even if they arent convincedWhich leads me back to the Bible  Part of the problem with labeling the Bible fiction is that it implies that it is a single book with a single author  nothing could be further from the truth  The old testament is a collection of myths creation myths and founding myths histories books that were written as history at the time of their composition which means something very different that it does today poems and songs and books that purport to tell the stories of various prophetsThe New Testament is similar with new genres being the Gospels a genre based in biography as it was written in the ancient world letters Acts its own genre but there were several others like it that werent canonized and an Apocalypse again there are other non canonical onesThis is the most important thing  the Bible is a collection of books  Its an anthology of books sacred to two groups of people and while some of them may have been intended as something approaching fiction though that would still mean something different to us than it did at the time of writing its wrong to categorical call the Bible all fiction or all anythingThe Bible belongs in nonfiction my friends  Sorry

author: DumbAsPooDoo
comment: As a person who has profited a bit from internet marketing this shit works as you can unfortunately see However I refuse to ever sink as low as using images of kids sick or healthy So a bit how this works for those who dont know Images that provoke a strong emotional response are posted with the requests for likes Things like sick children or messages of thanksgiving Many people click like to show support some click thinking  like   prayer Most of the religious macros you see shared on Facebook are not actually looking to spread religion but to get people to share the image If you go to the source of these images almost always the page that posts them will be filled with similar images and with links peppered in to an offsite The offsite will most likely be selling a product or service The hope is that through shares and likes awareness of the page will grow a huge amount some people will like the page and potential buyers are found Free advertising Affiliate links are also used If there arent any links or attempts to sell anything chances are that the page admin is attempting to first build an audience to either push a product later or sell the page to someone who wants to sell a product to an audience whose interests are knownI remember one image in particular that I saw my grandmother share It was an inspiring bible quote over a pretty image The image description asked people to like share and comment on what they were thankful for When I followed the link to the source there were plenty more images like this Every once in a while there was a link that said Are you ready to let Him help you with your finances and linked to a site selling an ebookmethod claiming to use Biblical advice to help you deal with money TLDR  essentially  of the images you see like this are people trying to profit in some way Theyre gaining an audience and are or will soon be trying to sell something They are aimed at suckers and generally dont believe in the cause they promote through the images

comment: Im posting this here because several people are essentially saying the same thing but God cannot exist on its own Someonething must have created it I have no desire to wait  minutes to copypaste three replies so here goesAll religions put defines God as omnipotent and outside of His own creation You cannot change the rules refute that and then say see I proved your religion wrong As an analogue its like this suppose I say that the theory is evolution is the idea that humans are evolved from Pop Tarts I then refute that by saying that since there are obviously humans before the invention of Pop Tarts the theory of evolution is therefore false So does this mean evolution as deified by ratheism is wrongNo I cant unilaterally modify something refute it then claim victory Similarly Abrahamic religions put God on a pedestal as an omnipotent eternal being You cant change that and then go and attack the idea asking God could not be eternal now who created God No one The core belief of religion is the omnipotence of God alpha and omega without a beginning or an end If theres a religion that claims God is not omnipotent then you can ask that question to them As it is youre barking at the wrong tree

author: fcdebate
comment: Thats called special pleading arguments for God dont have to follow the same rules as arguments for anything else even though I cant articulate a reason why that should beHowever because it relates to logic it also suffers from a pretty terrible reductio ad absurdum If God is immune to paradox he does not have to follow logical rules If he doesnt have to follow logical rules nothing of any interest can be said about him Why is this Because anything you say about God can be contradicted in the next breath and since God doesnt have to be logical both can be true No properties can be ascribed to God no qualities excluded from God Nothing said about God can be either wrong or right If God is immune to paradoxes then literally everything theists say about God is meaninglessIf you begin from contradictory premises you can deduce anything even contradictory propositions This is why most theologians do not say what your classmates didit would prevent them from making any logical argument that God exists and would prevent the proposition that God exists from negating the proposition that he doesnt

author: Oxiris
comment: Thats a type of word game One cannot be immune to paradoxes A paradox is basically a scenario where the law of noncontradiction is applied The paradox is not something external to god but the paradox is an action that he does or a quality that he has etcWhat they are doing is somewhat liken to the pathetic fallacy but in the sense that they are encapsulating god having omnibenevolence and god being able to torture for eternity as a paradoxOne can imagine god being immune to paradoxes as one could be immune to chickenpox and in this have somewhat anthropomorphized the word paradox as if it were an entity When what is happening is that what they are saying is God is immune to contradicting himself when he contradicts himself god having omnibenevolence and god being able to torture for eternity

author: datcrazybok
comment: TLDR I had the opposite experience being raised in the Salvation Army Im an atheist But my family is ministers for the Salvation Army My parents they were ministers until I was in the third grade and Ive still got Aunts and Uncles plus cousins who are officers  out of  sets of grandparents retired as officers Ill never forget this one time we were in Russellville Arkansas and it was a Sunday night service This man if he wasnt homeless he looked like he was Multiple layers of clothes despite the fact it was a rather warm night And man he stunk Anyways he showed up before the service and he stayed for the entire service After the service I noticed my mom and dad approach the man I didnt hear the conversation but I noticed that during the service the man had pissed on himself and the front of his pants were all wet as was the pew where he was seated Ill never forget my parents reaction They opened the food pantry made the gentleman a box of food and they offered him a ride home where ever home happened to be They offered to pick him up regularly for the services Basically they just treated him like a person And when it was all over they went back to the church and cleaned the urine out of the padded pews and cleaned up the van We didnt end up getting home until pretty late that night because of the extra effort my parents took with this gentleman EDIT We never saw him again either Another time my Uncle Tom he was also a Salvation Army officer he showed up to church after having been made up to look like a homeless man He quietly entered the back of the auditorium before the service and took a seat Sure enough people came and introduced themselves to him welcomed him to the service offered their pleasantries Then my Uncle walks to the front of the service and starts preaching He was moved to tears that his congregation was either just inherently great people or they had actually taken some of the lessons he was sharing to heart Just thought I would share my story Some people are assholes Some people are pious If they were more concerned about what Jesus thought they wouldnt be such assholes But God has very little to do with it If they are followers of Christ then everyone is welcome That God character though boy hes a little weird

author: NukeThePope
comment: This post correctly describes the psychological damage Christianity visits on countless children An excellent reason to resent the organizations that push this nonsenseBut while were bashing Id like to point out another form of damage and I dont feel qualified to judge so I wont which is the worseThis other damage is intellectual This may not be universally so but at least in the US it looks to me that clergy realize that the hairraising nonsense at the core of Christian doctrine can for the most part only be swallowed by people with broken faculties of reasoning and critical thinkingThe fundamental component the magic sauce of almost all religions is this there are facts to be known whose truth can and need not be established by reason and evidence Specifically revelation feelings in the heart are a respectable source and justification of true knowledgeThis single assertion once believed opens the floodgates to any and every kind of nonsensical assertion Aliens in UFOs are analprobing us  our souls live on when we die  black cats influence our fates with their movements some people have privileged nonworldly access to our dead relatives and knowledge of the futureand so on I think it was Voltaire who said if you can believe in a man walking on water you can believe anything As a result huge segments of the population in the US and elswhere of course are deliberately raised with broken truth meters Or stated more plainly for the benefit of religion the countrys youth is brought up to be a population of gullible idiotsEvery once in a while in rscience and elsewhere I run across articles describing some achievement that seems too good to be true a pharmacist mixing plastics in his kitchen developed a thermal plating that can resist thousands of degrees of heat an African girl has developed a cheap and simple process for extracting electricity from urine an American researcher now collaborating with NASA has developed a coldfusion reactor that produces energy from converting IIRC copper into tinWhen people like me point out some obvious objections to the possibility of these claims we get jumped by hordes of these gullible idiots who admonish us for being closeminded or who point out that applying scientific arguments to these claims isnt conclusive because science has been wrong beforeNow people can be poorly educated poorly informed and just plain wrong about things without the benefit of religion of course But I for one have a big problem with religions persistent efforts to keep people gullible so they can swallow the bullshit The intentionally cultivated widespread inability to tell truth from wishful thinking is holding all of humanity back Its like a residue of the Dark Ages still permeates society

author: fierceredpanda
comment: I certainly can relate Where animals are concerned I really wish I could buy into the whole Rainbow Bridge thing because I know that when my beloved cat passes away I will be an absolute mess The humananimal bond can be exceptionally strong and it doesnt seem fair that something so powerful can be terminated forever But its important to remember that the universe and life arent concerned with what seems fair  they just are what they are and false comfort is always false before it is comfortingBigger losses  thats hard Shortly after I finally decided to out myself as an atheist after a lot of selfdenial my wifes grandfather and my grandfather passed away both from strokes within three days of each other At both funerals and visitations I remember thinking and feeling a lot of things Ill list them here just for examples A degree of happiness Funerals are supposed to be celebrations of the deceaseds life In the case of grandparents look at the family they created Imperfect but a family nonetheless The idea that what we do while we live has no meaning after we die  thats total nonsense Even people with no families  look at all the people from entirely different backgrounds who are invariably brought together to say goodbye Take comfort from that There doesnt have to be any afterlife for our life right now to have meaning At the same time there is the sadness and awkward loneliness of sitting at a funeral listening to religious invocations and thinking about how empty it sounds Even in the case of someone who died after a long protracted illness hearing things like HeShe is in a better place now just sounds so hollow and degrading to this life the one that matters  And I think its difficult feeling like youre the only person at the gathering who isnt comforted by mentions of Heaven or salvation Certainly it would be a social faux pas to rain on everyones parade and say flat out This is all bullshit Instead a nonbeliever has to keep those feelings bottled up unless theres someone you know to be likeminded around In my case I waited until I got home from both funerals and sought out someone I knew would at least listen Ignoring grief doesnt make it go away Ever As a corollary to the last point Ill mention entirely without shame that I cried my eyes out at my grandfathers visitation The reason was simple I knew for a fact that despite what anyone else said I was and am never going to see him again That should make anyone sad Again I think its important not to lean on false consolation Remember the good times and know that a very real piece of the deceased still remains as long as you remember them  Ill add as a final note Humor even of the gallows variety can go a long long way to ease the feelings of loss Laughter really is the best medicine

author: johnnyfiend
comment: You want a physicist to speak at your funeral You want the physicist to talk to your grieving family about the conservation of energy so they will understand that your energy has not died You want the physicist to remind your sobbing mother about the first law of thermodynamics that no energy gets created in the universe and none is destroyed You want your mother to know that all your energy every vibration every Btu of heat every wave of every particle that was her beloved child remains with her in this world You want the physicist to tell your weeping father that amid energies of the cosmos you gave as good as you gotAnd at one point youd hope that the physicist would step down from the pulpit and walk to your brokenhearted spouse there in the pew and tell him that all the photons that ever bounced off your face all the particles whose paths were interrupted by your smile by the touch of your hair hundreds of trillions of particles have raced off like children their ways forever changed by you And as your widow rocks in the arms of a loving family may the physicist let her know that all the photons that bounced from you were gathered in the particle detectors that are her eyes that those photons created within her constellations of electromagnetically charged neurons whose energy will go on foreverAnd the physicist will remind the congregation of how much of all our energy is given off as heat There may be a few fanning themselves with their programs as he says it And he will tell them that the warmth that flowed through you in life is still here still part of all that we are even as we who mourn continue the heat of our own livesAnd youll want the physicist to explain to those who loved you that they need not have faith indeed they should not have faith Let them know that they can measure that scientists have measured precisely the conservation of energy and found it accurate verifiable and consistent across space and time You can hope your family will examine the evidence and satisfy themselves that the science is sound and that theyll be comforted to know your energys still around According to the law of the conservation of energy not author: Krazski
comment: I have worked in the animal industry as a veterinary assistant and a keeper so I am very accustomed to death Not only other peoples animals but a lot of my own It helps to understand the situation your petloved one was in Do you know why your hamster died I know it is much harder finding your pet already gone versus being able to have them euthanized with you by their side But I have always found comfort in knowing what caused the animals death Whether they had cancer or any other plethora of age related complications Most rodents from the pet stores do not last long and usually are rittled with tumors Also take comfort in knowing you gave her a much better life outside of what she was getting at the pet storebreeders

author: YourFairyGodmother
comment: Life is indeed confusing  It can be especially so for a  year old  I can assure you that it gets better    You wonder about the bible whether its true  Had you been born elsewhere you might wonder about the Koran  Or the Bhagavad Gita  Or just the Old Testament  Or  Think about that for a moment  Depending on who your parents are the bible is either true false or irrelevant  We are by nature afraid of the unknown Death has always been the biggest unknown for everyone  Whats more its natural to believe in godsghostssupernatural beingswwwyaleeduminddevlabpapersreligionisnaturalpdf  Thing is for most of mankinds history we had no clue about how the world works Now we know so much  We know what matter is we know how light works we make machines that almost seem to think  We also know quite a bit about the brain consciousness and stuff  We know that consciousness is a product of the brain There could be some way that when we die our consciousness remains in some incorporeal form But theres absolyutely nothing in all the physics and chemistry and science that we know which could possibly explain how that would work  Moreover in some ways all that science we know says it cant happen

author: darthbarracuda
comment: My simple beliefsNo evidence of God God is dismissed as fantasyNo evidence of an afterlife the afterlife is dismissed as a fantasy until death and if I do live on then I will be proven wrong Until thenLook up existential nihilism Thats part of my philosophy Just because theres no God doesnt mean your life doesnt have any purpose What you entire existence revolves around a stupid invisible man floating around in eternal vaguenessAtheism is a door to freedom Theres no longer that invisible camera monitoring you when you swear or dont go to church or masturbate or look at a member of the opposite sex slightly lustily youre  so am I We all go through that Its a natural thing caused from hormones and a developing sex drive You no longer will need to wake up early on Sundays to attend a building that begs for your money while promising a relationship and help from something imaginaryI was scared too when I first took on the title of atheism I tried to skirt around the corners attempting to find a way to satisfy my need for a deity without being a Christian or any other religious denomination I went from deism to panentheism to pantheism until finally ending up at atheism and realizing that I was still scared of something that I had rationally decided to be false It was then that I had my enlightening momentI hope you have the same luck does that even exist as I did when it came to discovering my true beliefs

author: BradTheImpaler
comment: My thoughts on In God We TrustI think it is important to clarify what exactly In God We Trust really means within the confines of our societyThere is always the argument that in God We Trust is an all encompassing phrase that covers the GodGods of every religion This is simply not the case this statement obviously refers to the God of the Abrahamic religions the most prominent being Judaism Christianity and Islam If the phrase is examined from a contextual standpoint if we look at who feels it is important and defends it it becomes a phrase rightly associated in this country with Christianity In all cases the phrase being official being placed on our currency etc is a blatant violation of the constitution and the idea of both freedom of religion and the separation of church and StateSo basically the phrase violates the constitutional rights of anyone who is not from and Abrahamic religion really anyone who is not a Christian and those who are agnostic or atheist

comment: You can be anything you want to be subject to your own limitations and the laws of physics Call yourself a snootling rutabaga for all I care The only thing that makes anyone an atheist is their answer to the question Do you believe one or more deities are objectively realIf the answer is anything other than Yes you are an atheistBeyond that there are additional semantic shenanigans one can play with orthogonal qualifiers like gnostic vs agnostic vs ignostic regarding knowledge claims etcBut it doesnt matter much what any person believes so much as how they allow those beliefs to affect their behavior

author: Dudesan
comment: From the FAQhttpwwwredditcomratheismwikifaqwikishouldicomeouttomyparentsasbeinganatheistFShould I come out to my parents as being an atheistThe short answer is NoThe slightly longer answer is that if you are not in a position where that is likely to end well for you you should probably wait until youre more selfsufficient However you know your own parents better than we do You could try breaking the ice on the subject of atheism to get a feel for their reaction to it in general if youre not sure Always keep in mind that for many people religion is a highly emotive subject and for many parents who have been raised to believe in the moral superiority of religious belief a child who comes out as an atheist can be interpreted as a betrayal of them or as a failure of their ownIn some religions it can actually be dangerous to out yourself If your father is a hardline Muslim for example getting kicked out of the house is the least of your worries You risk being beheaded or set on fire If youre coming from one of those keep that in mind as wellratheism will almost invariably respond that you should wait A common proverb here is The best place to come out to your parents is at a home you own over a dinner that you paid for yourself

author: DetailedVenom
comment: Bit late to the party here but Ill add my  centsWhen I was growing up I was raised Jewish no one in my family is Jewish except my paternal grandfather and since we were from Russia we wouldnt have been allowed to practice anyway My mother always wanted me to be raised a Jew probably for my grandfathers sakeFrom day  I didnt believe any of it I fell asleep in temple I never paid attention in Hebrew school and I was yelled at twice by our Rabbi for being disruptive When I turned  I had my Bar Mitzvah I memorized the whole verse I had to read since I couldnt actually read Hebrew because of the not paying attention After that was  more years of going to temple dressed in the shawl and Kippah that my parents paid a lot of money forAt  I told my mother I wasnt going to temple anymore and at  I told her I didnt believe in god I dont think she believes me but she isnt a hardcore religious nut she just wanted to appease her dad and it didPoint of the story I am happy that I went through that Not for any cynical reason but it is because of the kind of understanding you can only get from experiencing something At  I scoffed at religion and thought I understood all it had to offer Looking back now at  I realize how dumb I wasYou need to understand something very important you are a young fool All humans are stupid on some level but most arent aware of their own stupidity Everyone does what they think is right but very few people allow for the possibility that they are wrong While I agree with your assessment of Christianity I dont think you are old enough to really understand the implications of religion and what it could mean to your life Its going to suck doing things you dont believe in but you may gain something out of it in the endI have no idea if that helped but I hope it did Its all Ive got

author: Manny
comment: Im also a bit late to the party here but i would suggest not being closed to the whole Christianity thing just yet Or get too locked into it Atheism might be the way to go but truely no one can decide which is better except for you Do your research for BOTH sides of the argument There is nothing wrong with being a christian YES the chruch has issues some of them really large but Christianity does teach SOME incredibly solid values I grew up in the church I havent been for quite some time but i wouldnt have rather grown up in any other home My parents were respectful and faithful to each other kind to others incredibly generous and very fair to their children Of course this can happen in Athiest homes as well but the belief does do well to try and make people genuine Id recommend to tell your parents how you feel when when you feel ready Chances are theyve thought the same way at some point in time Its a human condition

author: xiipaoc
comment: Im going to disagree with everyone and say that nobody here but you can make this decisionLets start with some social issues  Do your parents accept gay marriage  Do they believe  in the catechism of the Catholic Church I saw in another comment that your family is Catholic  How do they feel about women being priests  Find out where they stand on a variety of social issues  It may be that they care about the Church  its their home congregation after all  but dont actually agree with much of its doctrine  You can tell them that youre having theological difficulties if you think there wont be much risk  Again it depends on how obsessed with believing in religion they are and note that religion isnt the same as belief  For example Im Jewish  I know a lot more about Judaism than my parents and I go to synagogue sometimes too which my parents dont do at all not even on the High Holidays  My parents think I go overboard with it even though I dont actually observe dietary or Shabbat restrictions or anything like that I just say prayers and sing songs and have meals  I wasnt actually atheist when I was   though I was never actually observant  but if I had been I think my parents would have wanted me to have a barmitzvah anyway  For us Judaism is a family tradition and we may not observe it very strongly but we observe it at least a little bit  We never believed in the literal truth of the Bible for instance  So when I casually mentioned to my parents that Im atheist  late in my s  the thing that surprised me the most was that they didnt already know  I thought Id mentioned it years earlier  I guess it had just never come up in conversation before and I didnt realize itAnyway that long story was to bring up the point that your parents may not actually care that youre atheist but they might care about you being a Catholic even if you dont believe their shit because your parents might not believe their shit either  I dont know your parents  You do  So make the right choice here

author: kingkongfoo
comment: Ill just let you know where I am coming from before answering your question I was raised atheist but free to make up my mind When I was around  I became a Christian but within a few years if all evaporated again Even though my experience was short lived I did read the Bible a few times cover to cover and that was enough to make me doubt my own sanity for taking it literally And if I am not supposed to take it literally then I can do without it tbh Its either truth or it is a manual for people who need answersI think that if you have parents that are willing to discuss this with you and try to answer any particular questions then talk to them IF theyre the types to try to convert you back at any cost then you might want to hold off on telling them Not because there is no Jesus cause none of us really know but because you need to know what you think for yourself without anyone guilt tripping youI am not from America though from northern Europe and I get that the whole society in the states are more heavily geared towards religion than it ever has been here That might be an issue that I am totally missing hereJust be true to your feelings either way lying to yourself ruins a lot more than your mood it compromises character

author: xrancorx
comment: My advice would be to start being honest with people  If theyre your friends they should accept you for who you are  You may lose some friends but youll have free time to spend seeking out social groups who are more accepting of your views  College is about discovering yourself and finding friends who you REALLY click with  They are out there I promise  As for going home be honest with your family if they ask but try not to alienate them  If not going to church would cause an eternal rift with your mother a couple hours each Sunday isnt too bad of a price to pay for a peaceful family relationship  But again honesty may make you feel less lonely and isolatedtldr be honest with friends and family those who mind dont matter and those who matter wont mind

author: cstokedizzle
comment: Youre not alone My family does not know that I am an atheist although they may be suspecting it by now I am  though and Ive done my own thing for a while but I am back in college and I am a member of the Secular Student Alliance Your campus should have one hopefully It really gives you a group of like minded people to talk with and you can make new atheist friends  Dont get discouraged and dont do anything rash Think of how bombarded you are by christian thoughts and opinions and how it turns you off You dont want to do that with your atheism You have to just plant seeds and share you opinions when asked You dont have to go along with theirs but be tactful when you do express your side Because they are going to try to rip you to shreds and get angry and pray for you and all that So try not to get angry take the intellectual and informed route

author: ashdot
comment: My advice Dont tell your family You dont need to LIE to them if they openly asked you do you believe in God it might be time to spill the beans but otherwise just keep it to yourselfWhen I was in college I was open about it with friends but you can pick your friends and you dont have to be friends with people who judge you You cannot pick your family You are stuck with them and based on a lot of other reaction posts I have read here you have a high chance of your family having a negative reaction It is the reason I am still in the closet with family almost  years after coming out to friends Not worth ruining the relationship with your parents over invisble unicorns that live in the sky

author: disharmonia
comment: I know theres going to be a storm about this so Im going to just jump in right hereI work at an abortion clinic  I am a health educator that goes over medical history with the patients and then explains their aftercare instructions and what they can expect  Since Im the person they get to sit down with and talk to Im usually the one that goes through their situation with them and sort of counsels themWe go up to  weeks and  days  We used to be able to go up to  weeks until the state capped us at   An injuction has allowed us to continue to go up to  weeks and  days at least for the time beingAbortions after twenty weeks are very very important  If you live in a state where abortions are capped please please try to help with advocates trying to overturn those lawsWhile amniocentesis can be performed at  weeks the results are iffy at best with some fetal anomalies not being able to be detected until the th week at the earliest  Most amnios happen around  weeks and the results can take up to  days to come backThis means that most women will have no idea if their infant has a fetal anomaly until after  weeks  This isnt just some FAs are detected after  weeks  I mean that the vast majority areIn my time at the clinic I have seen exactly one first tri FA patient  Meanwhile I regularly see four to five each week in their second trimester  They almost universally over  weeksYou also have to take into account that women dont instantly know if they want to continue with an FA pregnancy  There are a lot of anomalies that leave no choiceno brain no kidneys etc but there are ones like Downs that means the parents often have to sit down together and decide whether or not theyre capable of caring for a special needs childFor parents whove spent months bonding with their unborn infant this can be an absolutely wrenching decision  It can take weeks  And yet most of them have to told that they have only a few days to make up their mind  after that theyre SOLMost of the clients I see over  weeks are FA clients but there are also a reasonable amount of nonFA clients  Most of those remaining ones are minorsBecause teenagers dont have regular periods and because theyre teenagers it takes awhile for them to become aware that theyre pregnant  Then theres the fact that the vast majority are extremely unwilling to inform their parents  As our state requires the parent to be present unless the minor has a judicial bypass theres nothing we can do for them until they inform their parentsOften times this means weeks can pass before actions that need to be taken are taken  Most of my under clients are second trimesterIve also booked appointments for women who reach  weeks without being aware that theyre pregnant  This is more common than youd expect  its very possible to have a consistent period while pregnant  I know people boggle at the idea of a show about people who didnt know they were pregnant until they gave birth but stop to think about that for a moment  that happens often enough that they could make a show about itAnd no those people arent just idiots or rednecks  Ive seen women at  weeks that are skinnier than I am  Pregnancy is not just one predictable condition  It can be different for every woman and let me tell you it can be weird  Theres a reason we have an entire medical field devoted to itFor those who still dont get the importance of second trimester abortions we had a few women testify before the state house when the law limiting us to  weeks was being debated  They were women whod had Potters Syndrome babies wherein the kidneys do not form  This means that the baby can live so long as its inside the mother using her as a dialysis machine but once its born itll live for  days then die  There is no current cure or treatmentThis basically means that if a mother cant get an abortion she is forced to carry her child with a death sentence on its head to term  I still remember one woman talking about how shed go to the store and people asking her what names she was picking out and shed think to herself They think Im planning a nursery when all Im planning is a funeralDue to these testimonies House Democrats proposed an amendment saying that fatal problems with the fetus would be exempt  House Republicans being the majority voted down the amendmentThankfully the injunction is allowing us to still see women whore under  weeks but things are far from settledSecond trimester abortions are extremely important  dont underestimate that

author: HermesTheMessenger
comment: I read it years ago Repost responding to questions about CS Lewis apologetic writingsHeres my take on it I focus on the ideas of the person I am talking with   Even when someone borrows an idea from someone else they arent that other person  They are giving their own interpretation of that other persons ideas   Since it always comes back to what the person I am talking to thinks why dont they skip bringing in some third party and use their own ideas  ones that they understand and are able to discuss passionately and intelligently  Note This is why I hate plagiarists  Not only are they promoting someone elses work as their own stealing andor lying but they often dont really have a very good grasp of what the other person actually meant  This frequently leads to awkward questions that the thief cant give an informed response to  yet they often dont realize that they arent giving an informed response In the case of Lewis If his ideas were still of primary interest to Christians they would use them in their own arguments Back to the top There is no reason to focus on Lewis when theres a living person to talk to who has their own ideas  Lewis is unavailable

author: beerdemon
comment: First of all you have to have some clarity as to what you believe in and what you dont  Atheists can vary from total nihilists to believers in ufos ghosts and many nontheistic paranormal stuff  I doubt anyone has absolutely no beliefs whatsoever about where we come from what consciousness is how life originated and what are our goals in life  If you are talking about family loved ones and people you want to be happy with in the long term there is no point or gain in offending them  They will probably be offended anyway  When I had to defend my initial atheism and they claimed god this jesus that sin and virtue etc I just said well I happen to not believe that it makes no sense to me and when they asked for a better explanation just said I dont know I dont need to know I havent replaced certainty with better certainty I have embraced doubt and ignorance as a feature of humankind that is more likely to be true than magic certainty  When people get offended I say I am sorry we cant agree on it but in the same way you wont bend your belief to match my lack of it I wont fill the void with a belief to please you please lets have some more wine  That is when I care about the relationship  When I dontoh man I rub my hands and let the fun begin

author: Jyurian
comment: When asked I describe myself as atheos When they ask what that is I tell them that in ancient Greece the atheos were the ones who rejected the notion of the gods worshiped by the rest of Greek society Since there are many different gods in the US society Christianity Islam Judaism Hinduism Buddhism Native religions Scientology etc I tell them that I reject all of their notions of gods You mean like an atheist Well yeah the word atheist came from the Greek word atheos Hopefully that answer alleviates the whole devil worshiper thing

author: mredding
comment: gt I am anticipating many questionsExcuse me Im sorry but you seem to be mistaken You must have thought I am a subject a thing to be trivialized open to discussion wrong and in need of justifying myself to the likes of you or anyone In truth you are wrong on all accountsgt and criticismsExcuse me once again but it seems you have been misled to believe I give a flying fuck about your pretentious opinions when in fact I dont I never asked you and I certainly never invited you to share with me To be absolutely clear whatever you have to say on the subject I dont want to hear it And if you cant handle that then we need to reevaluate our relationshipgt How would yall handle the situationJust like that I dont ask them I dont pry I dont judge and I dont care And the day before they find out about me neither did they in kind Everything is alright so long as I conform to your world view To your expectations FUCK YOU Ive got people in my life better than the judgmental pricks in my familyThats not unconditional love Thats not mutual respect In that case as my grandfather taught me they need me more than I need them Thats damn rightgt How do yall explain your beliefs or lack there of to people who do not agree with youI dont need to justify myself to anyone my position does not need defending and I cant battle a foe philosophically speaking who is unyielding unchanging unwilling to be wrong There is no debate there is no educating these people they are going to pepper you with questions and ridicule not because they want to enlighten you or be enlightened but because in their mind theyre infalliable Theyre not worth your timeThe sooner you can identify these mindsets people arent made of stone their mood can change and become approachable at the right time the sooner you can avoid themThe first thing you need to do though is establish your confidence your willpower your dominance and your command over your domain A family party is no place to be holding this conversation and it is absolutely rude and unacceptable that they would flat out call you out in front of others or not first ask you permission HOW DARE THEY If you wish to address me you will do so politely respectfully and at the whims of my discretion You came to me I didnt come to you so I dont care if youre a child my grandparent or the President you will not disprespect meIm sounding quite harsh but thats because were on the internet and I have a point to get across You need to stand and be confident and dont get treated like a child Youre old enough to expose yourself to a hostile group youre old enough to act like an adault and not take shit But to address your question directly I speak matter of factly I define the terms belief and why accept and deny are better than believe or disbelieve and faith and explain their consequences I define proof evidence what falsifiable is and what the credentials of a definition of a god and will walk through their consequences how every definition basically fails I knock out fantasy and reality and destroy the supernatural or any notion that god can exist outside space or time and I come to my conclusion All this is most importantly with an air that this is not a debate I am confident I will not be moved they were not invited to forward a counter argument I can stop this at any time I already understand their position usually better than they do and so I dont need to hear itgt Also what are some good arguments you can make that is for atheismI cant even think of any anymore Its not worth the argument You cant change people and youre not going to Psychology research this year has reported the more you challenge a persons belief the tighter they cling to it You can only change yourself Dont worry about other people and what they think only worry about how they act especially toward you

land  Cursed are the Feeblebrained for they shall perish amidst plenty Blessed are the destroyers of Falsehope they are true Messiahs  Cursed are the Godadorers they shall be as shorn sheep Blessed author: MartinTheRound
comment: Christmas is a cultural thing Consider the connection between santa claus and jesus or the relationship between the easter bunny and jesus There isnt one Theres a minor connection between eggs and jesus eggs being symbolic or rebirth since they look inert and give life But all in all its all culture Some of the christian holidays are just hijacked pagan holidays But knowing all of this or being an atheist doesnt take away my enjoyment of christmas my anticipation of giving and receiving gifts and sharing my love for my family with them  Or the anticipation of decorating the tree Its just a slightly different celebration for atheists For me its about family So enjoy your christmas in a months time or a two weeks later if you have orthodox leanings or both if you prefer twice as many gifts EnojyAnd congrats on coming out and having it turn out okay Plus thanks for sharing

author: thc
comment: Instill within her a deep sense of curiosity Get her exploring Everything  her physical surroundings books everything Do this by showing her things shes never seen before The zoo museums planetariums etcGet her reading Get her to thirst for knowledgeTeach her to question everything The most frequent question that children ask is why Encourage her to ask that question Always answer that question honestly and straight Always take the time to give an answer not Daddy said so  If you dont know the answer tell her that and then set out together to find itTeach her about astronomy Get her interested in the planets and stars Get her a telescope Make sure she understands just how big the universe really is to whatever extent we humans can really understand thatTeach her mythology Show her all the cool pantheons we humans created over time Norse Egyptian Sumerian GreekRoman Hindu All of themFinally teach her what the scientific method is means and how to apply it Get a science kit Help her develop theories and test themAnd never ever argue with your wife about religion within earshot of your daughter NeverIf you do even most of those things shell be fine Especially if when shes  you suggest that she read The Bible covertocover

author: wataru
comment: Disclaimer You is a general you not the OP or anyone in particularI would wager that this letter was submitted to the paper as a joke Granted there are some pretty out there and clueless people in the world but that seems to me to be a bit too much But regardless of thatI am getting kinda sick of the whole being gay is a choicebeing gay is biological argument Whatever homosexuality stems from is not important At all As for myself I am gay Whether I choose to be this way or whether I was born this way has no bearing on anyone other than me So what if homosexuality is a choice Whats it to you The choice of where I stick my dick only matters to me and to the person into which I choose to consentually stick my dick Its not something that needs to be academically debated Its not something that other people need to agonize over or even discuss at all because it is none of their concern Other people dont get to have an opinion on this matter Whatever your personal moral beliefs are you have no right to subject me to them So let people say homosexuality is a choice Its a choice that I am allowed to make that doesnt affect you at all so you have no right to tell me I cant make it If I choose to paint the walls of my living room green if I choose to have Subway instead of Wendys for lunch or whether I choose to be gay or straight has no bearing on anyones life but mine Just because you have cultural bullshit to deal with doesnt mean you get to rain on my parade Personally I dont believe homosexuality is a choice When I look at a hot dude and I get a boner its because of a chemical reaction in my brain triggering sexual arousal Choice has nothing to do with it But neither does anyone elses opinion  In a manner of speaking I do choose to be gay I choose to ogle and stare when I see a hot guy on the street I dont care if it makes him uncomfortable Straight guys do it to women all the time Its a fucking compliment get over it I wish someone would do it to me I choose to gush over the most recent episodes of Project Runway and I watch Supernatural in the hopes that Dean and Castiel will finally lay the liplock on each other If I had a husband I would plaster my desk with pictures of us holding hands at Disney and kissing on the beach like every straight couple in the world does And you know what None of that requires anyone elses understanding or approvalA friend of mine who is a biology teacher said to me once that homosexuality is an aberration in the brain chemistry But it is a benign aberration It has no bearing on the survivability of the individual organism and if a small portion  like I dont know  or so  of the population especially in a species like humans that has no widespread breeding issues whatsoever has it it doesnt negatively affect the survivability of the species either So religious busybodies should mind their own fucking businessWhy would anyone choose to be gay Fuck that If it was up to me I would choose to be gay I love it and I dont give two shits if anyone doesnt like itTLDR  So what if homosexuality is a choice I choose it It doesnt affect you in any way Fuck off

author: BuccaneerRex
comment: Presumably any deity worth the title will know what evidence would convince me even if I dont know it myself If my being convinced is a desirable state for the deity then it will provide the evidence for its own existenceAs I remain unconvinced it therefore follows that either the deity does not want me to be convinced or does not exist

author: ahf
comment: There is no evidence to suggest that any deities exist  Were I presented with valid evidence I would of course change my mindWhat form would that evidence take  I have no idea  Heres what I do knowAccording to many religious traditions a deity exists that created me and possesses omniscience as well as omnipotenceIf a deity exists it knows that I am a skeptic and I would argue that it created me to be skeptical  Further it knows already exactly what evidence would convince me  Since it is omnipotent it is obviously capable of providing me with evidenceMany religions claim that God loves us and wants a relationship with us  If this claim is true then this deity would already have provided me with the evidence I need to believe in it  especially if my eternal salvation depends on itIf religions claims were true I would already be a believer it seemsSince Im not a believer I can only conclude that if any deities exist they dont seem to care whether or not I believe in their existence

author: ninterd
comment: gt Creationists and atheists both too often mistake it for a challenge to the existence of GodWhen we say this we specifically talk about the Gods of the religions with a different creation storygtThe reason I take it to be a nonissue is because while it explains a great deal about the origin of life on earth it does little to explain the more elementary questions of universal originsIts not supposed to explain anything else And its not even about the origin of life but the changes over timegtIf the universe can be shown to be infinite and eternal in the past there would be no need to posit the existence of God the universe would be selfsufficientSaying God is necessary for a finite universe is just an assumption Evidence pleasegtHowever if you take the Big Bang theory as being scientifically true as most cosmologists do then you have a valid sufficient and nearly necessary reason to posit the existence of something at the very least like GodNo not at all Maybe I dont understand where youre getting at but the Big Bang theory does not imply a God at all And the theory doesnt make an illogical belief like God justifiedgt If something like the universe and thereby space and time have a beginning then it is finiteWell maybe I dont see this as a problem though But I am not sure whether this is necessarily the case ask a scientistgtWhat is finite is contingent and what is contingent requires something beyond itself upon which it might existHere we go again with just illogical assumptions Maybe Ive misunderstood the definition of contingent because English isnt my first language but wouldnt a contingent universe disprove a personal creatorgt The only thing beyond the finite is the infinite so if the universe is finite it requires something infinite as its causeAgain youre just assuminggtBy inductive reasoning you can assess what sorts of characteristics this cause would have by logical necessity And some folks like myself find that the logical description of that cause is very similar to the traditional characteristics attributed to God ie changelessness timelessness immateriality infinity etcBy illogical reasoning you can assume that because you cant accept something we dont fully understand a god must have done it But you completely ignore the problems the God question itself creates How could a God possibly exist Why would God do this Why would you assume that God exists Why does the universe need a specific creator while God doesnt How can you justify belief in something infinite which we have no concept of at all its impossible to understand completely You cant possibly understand it and therefor is illogical to believe in

author: Dargo
comment: the reason that evolution is an issue is because it contradicts the bible and if one part of the book is wrong then it calls into question the rest of the book as well gtBig Bang theory as being scientifically true as most cosmologists dono they do not The big bang is currently the model that fits best and is far from being proven that being said your finite  infinite argument is no longer valid as you have no evidence for either Do you have evidence that something needs something to cause it If so what caused god to exist Hes eternal I hear you say then youve just negated your own argument that something did occur without a cause

author: Feinberg
comment: gtHowever if you take the Big Bang theory as being scientifically true as most cosmologists do then you have a valid sufficient and nearly necessary reason to posit the existence of something at the very least like GodWell you dont really You have a reason to think that the universe expanded out from a point but theres not really much to fuel speculation about events before the Big Bang We just plain dont know what happened before the Big Bang Positing a deity is unnecessarygtIf something like the universe and thereby space and time have a beginning then it is finiteWe dont actually know that they had a beginning though and even if they did we dont know that something existed before that beginning gtWhat is finite is contingent and what is contingent requires something beyond itself upon which it might existEverything which has been observed to have a beginning has a cause but the origin of the universe is a unique event and a unique class of events We dont know enough about universe origins to say that the things which apply to toasters and stars apply to the universe Also again we dont know that the universe if finite All we know is that observable matter appears to be moving away from a single point Another problem with this line of thinking is that one part of it the necessity for things to have a creator or cause rests squarely on what we know to be true of mundane objects through mundane observation The other part the deity requires the introduction of an entity with an abundance of supernatural properties which we have no basis to expect are possible There is no precedent to support the idea that something can be infinite or exist outside time and space for instance Frankly if we had reason to expect that these things were possible it would make more sense to apply them to the universe itself than a deityIf everything needs a creator then God would need a creator as well and that creator would need a creator ad infinitum If its possible for something to exist infinitely without a creator then Occams Razor would necessitate disproving an infinite universe before positing a creator for the universeFinally even if it somehow made sense to assert that the universe was caused to exist there is absolutely no reasonable bridge between that assertion and any specific personal intelligent deity

author: taterbizkit
comment: gt  By inductive reasoning you can assess what sorts of characteristics this cause would have by logical necessityThis sentence is confusing  Logical necessity is the language of deduction not inductionLets narrow down what universe means  We live in a spacetime continuum that may or may not be the entirety of all existence  Or it could exist within some other framework context structure or whatever  Which one is the universe For the sake of discussion Im using universe to mean everything that exists in its entirety  This is the only context in which this discussion is meaningful since what good does it do to say that our spacetime contiuum had a creator but not ask whether or not the creator exists within some finite context of its own  This also eliminates advanced alien beings from consideration since they too would live within a finite context It also eliminates matrixlike universes since the software would have to run on some hardware that itself existed in a nonsimulated finite contextSo were down at the roots here  The absolute origin of all originsAs you say it may be possible to intuit certain characteristics that it ought to have  Infinity sounds reasonable just based on your initial argument  Im not sure changeless counts because our comingintoexistence would be a change  Immateriality  this word loses its meaning once youre outside of our spacetime  So does time  Im not comfortable with timelessness for this reason  Its undefinedSo weve got infinity left still  Infinite seems to still be meaningful I guess assuming even that finite isnt a contextsensitive term that only has meaning to us as conscious beings  So maybe whateveritis is infiniteThats a lot of mental effort for not much result  How much does So its infinite I guess sound like a godOn the other hand if whateveritis is warped back on itself in  dimensions like a sphere in  or a ring in  then it can totally be finite and give rise to other finite things without itself having an origin in the infinite  It doesnt even need to be timeless if its warped back on itself in the time dimension  It could just be cyclical and entirely uncausedYeah I dont think we can draw any conclusions about it at all to be honest  I dont think induction or even deduction is going to get you anywhere if youre trying to do this in your head with a scientific laypersons understanding of cosmology  No a priori conclusion is going to be compellingAs always this question boils down to only one reasonable answerWe dont knowThere is no reason other than an appeal to ignorance to suppose that I dont know means so it must be god

author: kzielinski
comment: gt However if you take the Big Bang theory as being scientifically true as most cosmologists do then you have a valid sufficient and nearly necessary reason to posit the existence of something at the very least like GodThere are quite a number of cosmological theories that include what could be termed a big bang However they are sufficiently different from each other to make this kind of generalization invalid As two examples some theories posit a cyclic universe where what existed before the big bang was another universe that collapsed potentially ad infinitum While in others time is seen as thing that only started at the big bang meaning that there is no before and the question of what happened before the big bang just does not make sense So in asserting that either the universe is eternal or some god created it you are creating a false dichotomyhttpenwikipediaorgwikiFalsedilemma gt What is finite is contingent and what is contingent requires something beyond itself The idea that everything needs a cause has been show to be false Indeed what we seem to observe is that at the lowest level things happen without a cause all the time To give it a label you seem to be using the Ontological ArgumenthttpenwikipediaorgwikiOntologicalargument for the existence of god gt if the universe is finite it requires something infinite as its cause let me do a little word replacement to test thatIf a car is finite it requires something infinite as its cause No I cant say that I find that assertion particularly likely gt you can assess what sorts of characteristics this cause would have by logical necessityClearly I disagree However even if I didnt it would be a long way from Some kind of god exists to the Trinity Allah Brahman or Xenu exists But then this seems to bow down to the great Gewgew up the mountain  gt Anyway just wanted to say that some theists give a great deal of thought to the reason for their beliefThe problem lies in the question being asked not author: ewokjedi
comment: A vague god like this is more difficult to dismiss than the comic book characters you find in the bible or other religious texts but positing the existence of such a nebulous thing on such flimsy reasoning is for me qualitatively worse than accepting that we dont know It is tremendously convenient to dismiss all of life and biology for the sake of your argument And isnt it this the way it goes Scientists research and test probing the unknown or notwellknown until we have a sufficiently robust body of evidence to dispel the naive supernatural explanations of our forebears Where once god was an essential part of the explanation of life we now have an evermounting collection of nonsupernatural explanations Who said God becomes an everretreating pocket of uncertaintyOn the big bang theory I would point out that the notion of timelessness breaks down as you walk backwards towards it and the idea of what was before it is a form of nonsense question potentially Space and time are intertwined gt and what is contingent requires something beyond itself upon which it might existgt so if the universe is finite it requires something infinite as its causeAnd how do we know these things They sound like nonsequitirs You make a number of speculative claims here that just hold no currency for me What value is there in such speculation This just sounds like a protracted argument from ignorance

author: JinOhChoi
comment: Just some information if people are interestedYou can find the numbers here for the article Source httpwwwcensusdataabsgovaucensusservicesgetproductcensusquickstatopendocumentampnavposIve also included some information on What causes inaccuracy in the Census figures Source httpwwwcensusnoreligionorgWhat causes inaccuracy in the Census figuresFirst and foremost the question on the Census form is what is known as a leading question That is it is formulated is such a way as to elicit a desired answer A survey company using such a method would very quickly be dismissed as not worth hiringThe question reads What is the persons religionFirstly the phrasing of the question suggests the person has a religious belief The Atheist Foundation of Australia believes this is a false assumptionSecond the response options presented allows the person to write their religion of baptism or the religion they were introduced to as a child even though the individual may not hold any religious beliefs anymoreFurthermore the question lists the common religions at the top and places the No religion box at the bottom

author: AtheistPilgrim
comment: This is an old and desperate argument on the part of theists rational wiki has a good take on thishttprationalwikiorgwikiScientism and Daniel Dennett also has a good videohttpoldricharddawkinsnetvideosdanieldennettonscientism where he exposes this for the straw man argument it is The problem is that the author confuses science with scientism Science which is really about the scientific method is the only way to understand how the universe works In fact the test of any scientific theory is its ability to accurately predict Scientism is the view that only scientific claims are meaningful So want to build an airplane understand the building blocks of matter figure out how old the universe is Science it works bitches Want to talk about beauty art meaning of life Science may or may not be the tool you want For example the author statesThe claim that scientism is true is not itself a scientific claim not something that can be established using scientific methods Indeed that science is even a rational form of inquiry let alone the only rational form of inquiry is not something that can be established scientificallyIncorrect by definition He confuses Scientism with science here because science is by definition explored only with the scientific method and as it is evidence based it is also by definition rational  There is nothing self refuting about science writers like Richard Dawkins and Christopher Hitchens who allege that because religion has no scientific foundation or so they claim it therefore has no rational foundation at allThe author here implies that religion has a scientific foundation Now what does that tell you about the authorScientisim Its an allpurpose wildcard smearIts the last refuge of the sceptic When someone puts forward a scientific theory that they really dont like they just try to discredit it as scientismDaniel Dennett

man  concordant with evolution Men developed from animalsEverything  that follows is just a way to further explain this creation and how from that came the men Im sorry if may have used incorrect in a gruff got shit to do sort of way but he never took off his hat even in the houseI caught myself staring at the hat more than once actually awestruck that someone would wear it and admit that they driven hundreds of miles to visit a place that is wholly founded on lies bad science and delusional thinking  Then I thought well that isnt fair since we do send all our eighth graders to Washington DC each spring for a class tripAnyway so he works up the estimate and the price is fair but I dont really like any of the doors he offers compared to two other vendors so I tell him that at that time I dont think I want to do business and I hate it when clients give me the wanna think it over nonsense  Bull yes or no and no is okay yknow  So I am saying no in a nice wayHe stares at me points to the hat and asks me right out Is it because Im a Christian  Is it because of thisI take my time answering hold his gaze and tell him I dont like the style of the doors in your catalog  Your prices are fair and your cost to install was better than anyone else Ive looked at but I have to look at the door for the rest of my life in this house so I have to like it  Kinda the way you chose your religion I presume  Huh he gruntsBut truthfully all that hat represents to me is false advertising  Ive fallen for false advertising myself every four years so I know how disappointing that can beHe takes a sip of the coffee I offered him pushes the hat back and says My wife bought this for me  I usually wear it to the truck take it off and wear my business hat I just forgot I was wearing it  But I had to say something because you were staring at it like I had a sack of shit on my head and he laughs and so I laugh glad that the moment has passedWe shake hands he walks to the door to leave and just SarahhttpwwwbiblegatewaycompassagesearchGenesisampversionNIV  HagarhttpwwwbiblegatewaycompassagesearchGenesisampversionNIV  KeturahhttpwwwbiblegatewaycompassagesearchGenesisampversionNIV search for wiveshttpwwwbiblegatewaycomkeywordsearchwivesampversionampsearchtypeallampwholewordsonlyyes will bring up the references but will  also bring up any use of the word wivesI have heard this verse used to say that marriage should be between one man and one woman  Mark httpwwwbiblegatewaycompassagesearchMarkampversionNIV  However Jesus is just quoting Genesis httpwwwbiblegatewaycompassagesearchgenesisampversionNIV to show that he is a good Jew  Obviously since the time Genesis was written polygamy was acceptableI think you can also make the case with  Timothy  and  Timothy httpwwwbiblegatewaycompassagesearchtimothyampversionNIV that marriage to more than one woman is acceptable  the husband of but one wife and A deacon must be the husband of but author: NukeThePope
comment: Sounds good Or to use the appropriate vernacular I really want to believe Ive meanwhile read your piece Im sorry but now my personal verdict is that unless this is a satire youre either very poorly informed crazy or stupid What brought this on Thisgt Mark explains to Ruth that the park embodies all religious faiths under one roof It is the reason why there is no violence or bigotry in the world anymore All of the violence bigotry and intolerance is now performed in the park by way of amusements The park has created a place where all of the past horrors take place while the rest of the world now lives in peaceIm among this subreddits angriest antitheists yet not even I subscribe to the silly notion that religion is the root of all of our evils An analogy in medicine would be to claim that all human illness is a form of cancer No thats simply not trueTo try to put at least a vague number on the situation Axelrods Encyclopedia of Wars summarizes all historically recorded wars and concludes that only  were caused by or were significantly about religion Given the big competing motives for violence like simple greed for territory power or money that number looks plausible to me

author: datcrazybok
comment: Im in the same boat you are What I do is mostly ignore the stuff but it really wears on me So occasionally I will reply and Ill do my best to be as polite as possible Furthermore many times the forwarded emails are related to topics I have already wondered about in my head In those cases I try to be extrapolite and point out that I have struggled with the same questions Then I offer where I found more information which changed my mind It usually goes something like You know Aunt Anna I considered the same thought before I came out as an atheist After many hours of consideration I decided I would look the topic up and attempt to find as many facts about the topic as possible So while you make the claim A we actually know that A is untrue not logical bullshit pick one Something of that sort generally works when they know that not only has the thought been debunked but that it was something that I as an atheist considered before I made the choice to out myself as an atheist When they realize that youve already considered most of their ammunition then theyll stop shooting at you so much At least this was the case in my instance

author: freekyfrogy
comment: I was a creationist all of my life up until about a year ago Im  It wasnt so much that I bought into the creationist apologists logic but rather that I had it constantly drilled into my head that evolution was false during my childhood and teen years I didnt pay any attention to people like Ken ham or Kent Hovind growing up because I had no need to It wasnt until I actually started looking into evolution from a nonbiassed perspective that I started to look more closely at the arguments against evolution from a Christian perspective  Ironically the fact that the apologists arguments couldnt hold water against the scientific evidence for evolution is one of the main things that led me to look further into Christianity as a whole and realize was based on a weak Foundation made of assumptions and a startling lack of supporting evidence It was people like Ken Ham and Kent Hovind who played a key role in my deconversion

author: aftertheletterz
comment: I grew up as a Christian and lived in a very religious home As an only child we all were pretty close and they had a big influence on me I believed what my parents said to be rightNow my dad was and still is pretty obsessed with evolution being a lie Yes he went to college Bible college Anyways when I was younger I think like  or something He would show me the Hovind videos and I was really too young to realize how ridiculous they are Indoctrination I still believed in Santa for goodness sake Lol I know lameWell anyways I saw him read books like the evolution cruncher so i was pretty sure the world was  years old I wouldnt hear it from any evil evolutionist I was like this until the end of high school My boyfriend is an atheist and I was a Christian at the time but it didnt matter because we get along great He was just explaining some basic things about evolution and told me to consider it It was because of him I actually started to go online and look up things myself I had already started questioning my faith and dreaded church but this started to solidify that Fast forward a few monthsand we are here Im a atheist freshman at a very very Christian college Interestingly they teach evolution here  My new perspective on the world as an older entity is so thrilling to me and life seems so much more beautiful through the eyes of evolution Rather than it just happened god made it So yeah Im thinking of transferring colleges Its lonely here But thats just a bit on my former super creationist self I feel so much more comfortable in my skin and more inspired by the world than ever before

comment: Sometimes the person the arguments are told to is not knowledgeable enough to determine their validity This happened to myself when I was a teenager I believed a lot of creationist arguments because I simply did not know enough about things to determine whether they were actually good arguments But during and after highschool when I started to look stuff up on my own I noticed arguments for creationism and theism in general were simply intellectually dishonest most of the time or just simply not proof of anything really like the first cause argument It took a long while for that understanding of dishonest argumentation to turn into atheism and that was because I am a very rational and scientific person I imagine if I was more emotional andor dependent on other peoples opinions it would have turned into a defensive mindset about the whole issue andor a vilifying of the scientific method itself

author: Uncanevale
comment: I like this one better from HL MenckenThe way to deal with superstition is not to be polite to it but to tackle it with all arms and so rout it cripple it and make it forever infamous and ridiculous Is it perchance cherished by persons who should know better Then their folly should be brought out into the light of day and exhibited there in all its hideousness until they flee from it hiding their heads in shameTrue enough even a superstitious man has certain inalienable rights He has a right to harbor and indulge his imbecilities as long as he pleases provided only he does not try to inflict them upon other men by force He has a right to argue for them as eloquently as he can in season and out of season He has a right to teach them to his children But certainly he has no right to be protected against the free criticism of those who do not hold them He has no right to demand that they be treated as sacred He has no right to preach them without challenge

author: datcrazybok
comment: I am torn on this one because the Jews had prophecy which indicated that the Messiah was coming there were many individuals who made the claim that they were this Messiah of prophecy Many many individuals actually All evidence Ive read seems to indicate that several decades after the fact people confirm Jesus existed However given the decades lapse in the time which Jesus exists and the historical claims of Jesus you can assume that AT THE VERY LEAST some of the facts regarding Jesus were muddled In fact I theorize that those who described Jesus later on were simply confirming that many individuals had made the claim to fulfill Jewish prophecy and that a few decades ago another one happened However I have also read that people were executed as often as monthly for the same crime that Jesus was supposedly executed for So basically although historical scholars generally accept the fact that Jesus existed when I look at their evidence I cant help but feel that it describes an individual who claimed to fulfill Jewish prophecy rather than this specific individual since none of the mentions really gives specific evidence that claims made in the New Testament actually happened Im with you though Whether or not a man caused a major revolution in Judaism about  years ago offers no insight into whether or not the historical Jesus existed and certainly no insight into whether or not he was divine In that sense to me it really doesnt matter at all There were plenty of people who claimed to be the one to fulfill prophecy
